title: How to Pull a Gaming All Nighter

steps.headline: Buy a lot of coffee, tea, or some kind of energy drink.
steps.description: Unless you can already stay up all night, one of these drinks is recommended for staying awake, but avoid drinking excessive amounts or you could crash the next day or you might have to use the bathroom too much. Also, make sure you eat before you drink coffee.

steps.headline: Download or buy, then install the game you want to play.
steps.description: Having more than one game will ensure that you do not get bored, but it's not compulsory. Make sure you play a game that you won't get bored of easily, or else you might end up falling asleep.

steps.headline: Find a suitable environment for gaming.
steps.description: Find a comfortable chair and desk, or even use your sofa. As a precaution, do not use a bed or anything too comfortable, as you may fall asleep.

steps.headline: Invite some friends, if desired.
steps.description: Talking to people can help keep you awake, improve your mood, and make gaming more fun.

steps.headline: Game away!
steps.description: Get your controller, mouse, keyboard, or whatever you need to start gaming.

steps.headline: Every hour or so, take a ten-minute break.
steps.description: This will prevent headaches, dry eyes, and tired fingers. Use the restroom, have some coffee, tea, or whatever you have, and maybe even sneak in some food. If there's a point of the game where you have to wait for some time, (such as waiting for day to come in Minecraft) do something that can entertain you until the wait is over.

steps.headline: If you want to, listen to music as you play, but make sure you keep the volume quiet enough that you can hear movement outside your room.
If you cannot sleep through the next day for whatever reason, preserve your energy.
steps.description: Do not go to the gym and do not play any extreme sports.

steps.headline: Drink plenty of water and eat healthy foods.
steps.description: Even if you are too tired to eat, food will keep you awake, and it could be your only source of energy. If you already drank coffee for your all-nighter, don't drink more, and don't drink coffee unless you've eaten.

steps.headline: Take short naps whenever possible.
steps.description: This will help you avoid falling asleep if you are working, at school, driving, etc.

text: Preparing Buy a lot of coffee, tea, or some kind of energy drink. Unless you can already stay up all night, one of these drinks is recommended for staying awake, but avoid drinking excessive amounts or you could crash the next day or you might have to use the bathroom too much. Also, make sure you eat before you drink coffee. Download or buy, then install the game you want to play. Having more than one game will ensure that you do not get bored, but it's not compulsory. Make sure you play a game that you won't get bored of easily, or else you might end up falling asleep. Find a suitable environment for gaming. Find a comfortable chair and desk, or even use your sofa. As a precaution, do not use a bed or anything too comfortable, as you may fall asleep. Invite some friends, if desired. Talking to people can help keep you awake, improve your mood, and make gaming more fun. Pulling the All-Nighter Game away! Get your controller, mouse, keyboard, or whatever you need to start gaming. Every hour or so, take a ten-minute break. This will prevent headaches, dry eyes, and tired fingers. Use the restroom, have some coffee, tea, or whatever you have, and maybe even sneak in some food. If there's a point of the game where you have to wait for some time, (such as waiting for day to come in Minecraft) do something that can entertain you until the wait is over. If you want to, listen to music as you play, but make sure you keep the volume quiet enough that you can hear movement outside your room.  Recovering If you cannot sleep through the next day for whatever reason, preserve your energy. Do not go to the gym and do not play any extreme sports. Drink plenty of water and eat healthy foods. Even if you are too tired to eat, food will keep you awake, and it could be your only source of energy. If you already drank coffee for your all-nighter, don't drink more, and don't drink coffee unless you've eaten. Take short naps whenever possible. This will help you avoid falling asleep if you are working, at school, driving, etc.
